dedukti: thm10FermatLittle : (p : Elem Nat) -> Proof (prime p) -> (a : Elem Int) -> Proof (exists Int (q => Eq (minus (pow a p) a) (times p q))) .
agda: postulate thm10FermatLittle : (p : Nat) -> prime p -> (a : Int) -> exists Int (\ q -> Eq (minus (pow a p) a) (times p q))
coq: Axiom thm10FermatLittle : forall p : nat, (prime p -> ((a : Int) -> Exist Int (fun q => pow a p - a = p * q))) .
lean: axiom thm10FermatLittle (p : Nat) (_ : prime p) (a : Int) : Exist Int (λ q => pow a p - a = p * q)

dedukti: thm19 : (n : Elem Nat) -> Proof (exists Nat (a => exists Nat (b => exists Nat (c => exists Nat (d => Eq n (plus (plus (plus (square a) (square b)) (square c)) (square d))))))) .
agda: postulate thm19 : (n : Nat) -> exists Nat (\ a -> exists Nat (\ b -> exists Nat (\ c -> exists Nat (\ d -> Eq n (plus (plus (plus (square a) (square b)) (square c)) (square d))))))
coq: Axiom thm19 : forall n : nat, Exist nat (fun a => Exist nat (fun b => Exist nat (fun c => Exist nat (fun d => n = square a + square b + square c + square d)))) .
lean: axiom thm19 (n : Nat) : Exist Nat (λ a => Exist Nat (λ b => Exist Nat (λ c => Exist Nat (λ d => n = square a + square b + square c + square d))))

natural: Thm20a. Every prime number of the form $4k+1$ can be written as the sum of two squares.
Thm20a. If $p=4k+1$ is a prime number then $p$ can be written as the sum of two squares.

dedukti: thm20b : (p : Elem Nat) -> Proof (prime p) -> Proof (congruent p 1 4) -> Proof (exists Nat (x => exists Nat (y => Eq p (plus (square x) (square y))))) .
agda: postulate thm20b : (p : Nat) -> prime p -> congruent p 1 4 -> exists Nat (\ x -> exists Nat (\ y -> Eq p (plus (square x) (square y))))
coq: Axiom thm20b : forall p : nat, (prime p -> congruent p 1 4 -> Exist nat (fun x => Exist nat (fun y => p = square x + square y))) .
lean: axiom thm20b (p : Nat) (_ : prime p) (_ : congruent p 1 4) : Exist Nat (λ x => Exist Nat (λ y => p = square x + square y))

dedukti: thm51wilson : (n : Elem Nat) -> Proof (iff (prime n) (congruent (factorial (minus n 1)) (neg 1) n)) .
agda: postulate thm51wilson : (n : Nat) -> iff (prime n) (congruent (factorial (minus n 1)) (neg 1) n)
coq: Axiom thm51wilson : forall n : nat, (prime n <-> congruent (factorial (n - 1)) (neg 1) n) .
